message:
Ideas?

Context:

My client uses AbcPdf (so, thanks, but it's unlikely to move to something else now). I'm running a thing on Windows 10, and according to Docs, the version I use (AbcPDF 9) supports IE11.

But some styles (only few of them) are not applied. I could spot a case where things like ":not(.some-class)" isn't working, although it's working in normal page when opened in IE11.

I looked for options, saw Selectivizr, but it seems to do nothing (I think I load it correctly, after jQuery and styles).

My assumption is that AbcPdf is working in some earlier IE mode or something. Is there any other option that adds the ":not()" etc selectors to earlier IE?

Or maybe, is there any way I can make sure AbcPDF is using the full capabilities of IE11 installed?

Thanks.

data.message: لو الموضوع خاص بعرض البى دى اف فى البروزر ففى فكرة عبيطة احب اشارك بيها, ممكن تحول الملف لصور- عند الطلب - وتعرض الصور فى يوزر كونترول ليه نفس مفاتيح البى دى اف فييوار , يرسل للسرفر يعدل فى الصور ويرجعها او يطلب الصفحة الى بعدها او الى قبلها.

I'm not sure if this is useful in your case or not, but I know that to make sure IE11 uses all it's supported features, you put this in the head:
<meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge" />
I just confirmed that it renders as IE 9 (printed the classes in the conditional comments around the HTML tags), which is crazy because it's running on a Windows 10 machine that only has IE11.

I guess THIS must be related
https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10153882092600170&set=a.10150382365805170.409044.544815169&type=3
Anyone with Windows 10 machine can tell me what they get for this?
